Sentencas: In this article, first, a CHP system using a solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) is introduced.
Titulo: Electrochemical and thermodynamic modeling of a CHP system using tubular solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC-CHP)

Sentencas: The influence of several effective parameters (such as cell temperature, pressure, fuel utilization coefficient, and system air-to-fuel ratio) on SOFC-CHP performance is investigated.
Titulo: Electrochemical and thermodynamic modeling of a CHP system using tubular solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC-CHP)

Sentencas: In order to obtain an exact solution, the reforming, electrochemical and thermal models are introduced and solved simultaneously.
Titulo: Electrochemical and thermodynamic modeling of a CHP system using tubular solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC-CHP)

Sentencas: In addition, the power and heat generation diagrams as well as the cell voltage loss under different working conditions are obtained.
Titulo: Electrochemical and thermodynamic modeling of a CHP system using tubular solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC-CHP)

Sentencas: The results show that as temperature and pressure increase, the cell power increases; however, the temperature is more effective.
Titulo: Electrochemical and thermodynamic modeling of a CHP system using tubular solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC-CHP)

Sentencas: Also, the results indicate an overall SOFC-CHP system efficiency of about 73%.
Titulo: Electrochemical and thermodynamic modeling of a CHP system using tubular solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC-CHP)

Sentencas: Finally, the optimum air-to-fuel ratio and fuel utilization coefficient are determined as 9.4 and 0.85, respectively.
Titulo: Electrochemical and thermodynamic modeling of a CHP system using tubular solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC-CHP)

Sentencas: As a final conclusion, the selection of system operating conditions must be made on the basis of the thermal and electrical needs of the specific building.
Titulo: Electrochemical and thermodynamic modeling of a CHP system using tubular solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC-CHP)
